column4: I have a .bin/.cue KVCD that I want to watch, what can I use to open/convert the .bin to something ubuntu reconizes?
I have a .bin/.cue KVCD that I want to watch, what can I use to open/convert the .bin to something ubuntu reconizes?
formally compiz, now beryl
bchunk
bchuck can convert .bin to .iso?
I believe so, I just did "apt-cache search .cue iso"
meaning... (kinda new)
I just did a quick keyword search for packages
ahh ok.
is super grub loader easy way to correct windows overriding grub? Cuz i still want Ubuntu as my main OS, not windows.
I have never used super grub before, the instructions on the wiki for restoring grub aren't very hard though
..yes, but it still gets me confused when i deal with hard drive paritioning things.. i don't really know how linux sets up HDD and whatnot
You don't need to just follow the instructions, they go step by step through it
why gksudo gparted?
Do a "chmod + x whatever.bin" then ./whatever.bin
what?? what does that do?..
Or right click it, go to properties and make it executable, then double click it
Makes it executable then runs it
ok, wine trys to open it and then nothing happends. it's supposted to be for linux..
Wine should not be trying to open it, did you set it to executable?
it already says type executable
When you right click it and go to properties, then the permissions tab, is "Allow executing file as a program" checked?
